about.title: What is JavaScript
about.description: JavaScript is a programming language commonly used in web development. it was originally developed by Netscape as a means to add dynamic and interactive element to websites. While JavaScript is influenced by Java, the syntax is more similar to C and is based on ECMAScript.  A scripting language developed by Sun Microsystems

code.var: containers for storing data or value.
code.const: const cannot be redeclared, reassigned, and have black scope.

code.if: Where if condition is true, it used to specify execution for a block code.
code.else: Where if the same condition is false it specifies the execution for a block of code.
code.else if: This specifies a new test if the first condition is false.

code.switch: Is used to perform different actions based on different conditions.
code.break: This will stop the execution instide the switch block.
code.default: Specifies the code to run if t here is not case match.

code.for: The most common way to create a loop in JavaScript.
code.while: Sets up condition under which a loop execute.
code.do while: Similar to the while loop, however, it executes at least once and performs a checkat the end to see if the ocndition is met to execute again.
code.break: Used to stop and exit the cycle at certain conditions.
code.continue: Skip parts of the cycle if certain conditions are met.

code.alert(): Output data in an alert in the browser window.
code.confirm(): Opens up yes/no dialog and returns true/false depending on user click.
code.console.log(): Writes information to the browser console, good for debugging purposes.
code.document.write(): Creates an directly to the HTML document.
code.prompt(): Creates an dialogue for user input
code.parseInt(): Parse its argument and return an integer

code.chart(): Return a character at a specified positioning inside a stirng.
code.concat(): Concatenate (joins) two or more string into one
code.indexOf: Provides the position of the first occurence of a specified text within a string.
code.match(): Retrieves the matches of a string against a search pattern.
code.replace(): Find and replace specified text in a string
code.slice(): Extracts a section of string andd returns as a new string.
code.substring(): Also simillar to slice() but can't accept negative indices.
code.valueOf():: Return the primitive value of string object.

code.indexOf(): Return the first position at which at given element appears in an array.
code.pop(): removes the last elemnt of array.
code.push(): Add new elemnt at the end of the array.
code.reverse(): Reverse the order of the elements in an array.
code.shift(): Remove the first element of the array.

code.this: Used inside the method to access the object's properties.
code.delete: Removes a property from an object.
code.in: Check if a property is exist in an object.
code.for...in: iterates over properties of an object.

code.onClick: The event occurs when the user clicks on an element.
code.onMouseOver: when the pointer is moved onto an element or one of its children.
code.onKePress: The moment the user starts pressing a key.
code.onScroll: An element being scrollbar is being scrolled.
code.onInput: A user input on an element.
code.onSelect: The user selects some text (for input and textarea.

code.try: Lets you define a block of code to test for error.
code.catch: Set up a block of code to execute in case of an error.
code.throw: Create custom error messages instead of the standard JavaScript errors.
code.finally: Lets you execute code, after try and cactch, regardless of the result
code.RangeError: A number is out of range
